step.para: Install the OpenStack Dashboard as root:

screen.userinput: yum install -y memcached python-memcached mod_wsgi openstack-dashboard

step.para: Modify the CACHE_BACKEND environment variable in /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings to match the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.conf.
Open /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings and look for this line:

note.para: The address and port must match the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.
If you change the memcached settings, you must restart the Apache web server for the changes to take effect.
In this example, memcached is the session store for the OpenStack Dashboard. You can use other options. Each option has benefits and drawbacks.
To change the timezone, use the dashboard or edit the /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py file.
